Parameters: Activity: The Activity object which will have its metrics measured.
add(android.app.Activity).Description: Starts recording frame metrics for the given activity.

Parameters: int: A bitwise collection of flags indicating which metrics should be recorded.
FrameMetricsAggregator(int).Description: Constructs a FrameMetricsAggregator object that will track the metrics specified bty metricTypeFlags, which is a value derived by OR'ing together metrics constants such as @B_android#support#v4#app#FrameMetricsAggregator#TOTAL_DURATION_E@ to specify all metrics that should be tracked. For example, TOTAL_DURATION | DRAW_DURATION will track both the total and draw durations for every frame.

Returns: An array whose index refers to the type of metric stored in that item's SparseIntArray object, e.g., data for TOTAL_DURATION is stored in the [TOTAL_INDEX] item.
Parameters: Activity: The Activity to stop tracking metrics for.
remove(android.app.Activity).Description: Stops recording metrics for activity and returns the collected metrics so far. Recording will continue if there are still other activities being tracked. Calling remove() does not reset the metrics array; you must call @B_android#support#v4#app#FrameMetricsAggregator#reset_E@ to clear the data.

Returns: An array whose index refers to the type of metric stored in that item's SparseIntArray object, e.g., data for TOTAL_DURATION is stored in the [TOTAL_INDEX] item.
reset().Description: Resets the metrics data and returns the currently-collected metrics.

Returns: An array whose index refers to the type of metric stored in that item's SparseIntArray object, e.g., data for TOTAL_DURATION is stored in the [TOTAL_INDEX] item.
getMetrics().Description: Returns the currently-collected metrics in an array of SparseIntArray objects. The index of the array indicates which metric's data is stored in that SparseIntArray object. For example, results for total duration will be in the [TOTAL_INDEX] item. The return value may be null if no metrics were tracked. This is especially true on releases earlier than API 24, as the FrameMetrics system does not exist on these earlier release. If the return value is not null, any of the objects at a given index in the array may still be null, which indicates that data was not being tracked for that type of metric. For example, if the FrameMetricsAggregator was created with a call to new FrameMetricsAggregator(TOTAL_DURATION | DRAW_DURATION), then the SparseIntArray at index INPUT_INDEX will be null. For a given non-null SparseIntArray, the results stored are the number of samples at each millisecond value (rounded). For example, if a data sample consisted of total durations of 5.1ms, 5.8ms, 6.1ms, and 8.2ms, the SparseIntArray at [TOTAL_DURATION] would have key-value pairs (5, 1), (6, 2), (8, 1).

FrameMetricsAggregator().Description: Constructs a FrameMetricsAggregator object that will track @B_android#support#v4#app#FrameMetricsAggregator#TOTAL_DURATION_E@ metrics. If more fine-grained metrics are needed, use @B_android#support#v4#app#FrameMetricsAggregator#FrameMetricsAggregator_E@ instead.

Returns: An array whose index refers to the type of metric stored in that item's SparseIntArray object, e.g., data for TOTAL_DURATION is stored in the [TOTAL_INDEX] item.
stop().Description: Stops recording metrics for all Activities currently being tracked. Like @B_android#support#v4#app#FrameMetricsAggregator#remove_E@, this method returns the currently-collected metrics. Calling stop() does not reset the metrics array; you must call @B_android#support#v4#app#FrameMetricsAggregator#reset_E@ to clear the data.

ClassDesc: This class can be used to record and return data about per-frame durations. It returns those results in an array per metric type, with the results indicating how many samples were recorded for each duration value. The details of the durations data are described in @B_android#support#v4#app#FrameMetricsAggregator#getMetrics_E@. For more information on the various metrics tracked, see the documentation for the
